title: Efficient Multimedia Data Search for User Created Contents (UCC) (11／14(화) 오후2시30분／교수회의실)
content:
세미나제목: Efficient Multimedia Data Search for User Created Contents (UCC)

강 사 : Ji-Hwan Kim (LG Electronics Inc. / Ph.D. Univ. of Cambridge)
일 시 : Date & Time: November 14, 2:30pm-4:00pm
장 소 : Faculty Conference Room

Contents of the Presentation:

  1. Rapid Growth in the Amount of Multimedia UCC
  2. User Participation in Web 2.0 & its Effect on the Amount of Multimedia UCC
  3. Need for Efficient Multimedia Data Search
  4. Research Objective
  5. Related Research at Cambridge Univ.

Abstract:

The volume of available multimedia data across the internet has grown rapidly, 
because recent advances in mobile devices and high speed internet have enabled 
users to easily create their own contents, called UCC, and disseminate them through 
the internet. The amount of multimedia UCC will become more prevalent after mobile 
high speed internet, such as HSDPA, and internet television, called IP-TV, becomes 
more popular, as thousands of people will create and upload all kinds of videos; from 
casual to the carefully constructed, anywhere and anytime. As the size of UCC grows 
organically by user participation and while much of it is not well organised, the initiative 
to the data on Web 2.0 belongs to the owners of platforms where the user can easily 
find out the data that they want, not to data owners. In other words, the core competency 
on Web 2.0 comes from the way in which an efficient data search can harness collective 
intelligence. This presentation describes the research objective for efficient multimedia 
data search for UCC, which aims to find automatic ways of indexing, categorising, and 
searching large volumes of multimedia data using speech and dialogue understanding.  
Related research conducted at Univ. of Cambridge will be presented.


Key Words: Multimedia Data Search, User Created Contents (UCC), Web 2.0
